unnormalised: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) reported a marginal increase in the retail inflation rate during the month of Oct’24. Rising vegetable prices, particularly in urban centers like Mumbai and Delhi, contributed to the uptick. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) for retail purchases reached 5.1%, a slight increase from the 4.9% recorded in Sept’24. Economists attribute this rise to seasonal factors and supply chain disruptions following the monsoon season.
normalised: The Reserve Bank of India (R-B-I) reported a marginal increase in the retail inflation rate during the month of October two thousand and twenty four. Rising vegetable prices, particularly in urban centers like Mumbai and Delhi, contributed to the uptick. The Consumer Price Index (C-P-I) for retail purchases reached five point one percent, a slight increase from the four point nine percent recorded in September two thousand and twenty four. Economists attribute this rise to seasonal factors and supply chain disruptions following the monsoon season.

unnormalised: Market analysts noted that the cost of essential commodities, including pulses and edible oils, also saw a moderate rise. The average price of toor dal increased by ₹5 per kg, while sunflower oil rose by ₹3 per liter in wholesale markets across Maharashtra. Small-scale vendors and kirana stores reported decreased profit margins due to the increased procurement costs. This potentially impacts household budgets, especially for low-income families.
normalised: Market analysts noted that the cost of essential commodities, including pulses and edible oils, also saw a moderate rise. The average price of toor dal increased by rupee five per kilogram, while sunflower oil rose by rupee three per liter in wholesale markets across Maharashtra. Small-scale vendors and kirana stores reported decreased profit margins due to the increased procurement costs. This potentially impacts household budgets, especially for low-income families.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the RBI’s monetary policy committee (MPC) is scheduled to meet next month to review the current interest rates and formulate strategies to manage inflation. Experts suggest the committee might consider a repo rate hike of 25 bps to curb inflationary pressures. The last rate hike was implemented in Feb’23. The outcome of the meeting will significantly influence lending rates and consumer spending in the coming months.
normalised: Furthermore, the R-B-I’s monetary policy committee (M-P-C) is scheduled to meet next month to review the current interest rates and formulate strategies to manage inflation. Experts suggest the committee might consider a repo rate hike of twenty five basis points to curb inflationary pressures. The last rate hike was implemented in February two thousand and twenty three. The outcome of the meeting will significantly influence lending rates and consumer spending in the coming months.

unnormalised: Consumers in major metropolitan areas such as Kolkata and Chennai have observed the changes and voiced their concerns regarding these price hikes via online forums and market surveys. These surveys highlight the urgency for government intervention and regulatory measures to stabilize the retail market and ensure affordability of essential goods for the general public. Some consumers indicated a shift in their shopping habits towards cheaper alternatives or bulk purchases to mitigate the impact of inflation on their monthly expenditures.
